I did a system-wide install on Ubuntu (Linux Kernel) after going through similar troubles you mention.
I am guessing the rational behind the preferred approach is to preserve the state of mission-critical machines by not altering the code base of dependencies. For recreational users like us, the native pip install looks to be better in flexibility.

I did a system-wide install on Ubuntu (Linux Kernel) after going through similar troubles you mention. 
I am guessing the rational behind the preferred approach is to preserve the state of mission-critical machines by not altering the code base of dependencies. For recreational users like us, the **native pip install** looks to be better in flexibility.
